snippet: Florida violated the National Voter Registration Act in trying to “systematically” remove noncitizen voters from the rolls within 90 days of the 2012 presidential election.
abstract: Florida Gov Rick Scott's effort to remove voters who are not American citizens from voter registration rolls suffers one-two punch when federal appeals court rules against program and Florida's state secretary Ken Detzner decides to temporarily suspend program.
lead_paragraph: Florida violated the National Voter Registration Act in trying to “systematically” remove noncitizen voters from the rolls within 90 days of the 2012 presidential election.

headline.main: In Florida, Bid to Cut Voter Rolls Is Set Back
headline.print_headline: In Florida, Bid to Cut Voter Rolls Is Set Back
